definition[0]: if a business underperforms, it does not make as much profit as it expected to make
definition[1]: if a company, investment etc underperforms, it is not as profitable as it should be, or as profitable as similar companies investments etc
example[0]: In keeping with the general trend, the larger services companies were seen to have underperformed compared to smaller ones.
example[1]: In Canada, stocks underperformed their British counterparts.
